text:
The Summer rain stopped, 
in the middle of the night, 
I strolled on the bridge, 
looking at the moom yonder, 
smiling at the thought of you.

The wind was rising, 
it brought in the dark rainclouds, 
raindrops start to fall, 
ringing the copper chimes, 
I hear your voice calling me

Dreamy countenance, 
drinking and dancing alone. 
I sat down and watched, 
a heart breaking in the rain. 
Do you see me now? You asked.

Dusty folio, 
hiding a red maple leaf. 
In the candle light, 
I see you writing my name, 
a new teardrop blurre old ink.
